result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Scalissi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J Scalissi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter J Scalissi was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Peter J Scalissi was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur & concur to all other cases.
3/30/16 Crt orders 33 days of credit should be applied if probation is ever revoked. Previously 0 days of credit. All other conditions remain the same.

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-already on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

AMENDED CASH BOND - TO TEMPORARILY REVERT TO A SIGNATURE BOND ON WEDNESDAY, JULY 15, 2015 AT 10:00 A.M. TO ALLOW HIM TO ATTEND HIS FATHER'S FUNERAL IN OREGON, WI.
DEFENDANT SHALL RETURN TO THE DANE COUNTY JAIL NO LATER THAN WEDNESDAY, JULY 15, 2015 AT 6:00 P.M. - UPON HIS RETURN TO THE JAIL, THE DEFENDANT'S $500 CASH BOND SHALL BE REINSTATED.
- Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle during his absence from jail
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol and shall not use or possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
- Defendant shall remain in the presence of Tom Jaggers while out of custody from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on Wednesday, July 15, 2015.
- Upon his return to the jail the defendant shall submit to any chemical tests of his blood, breath, or urine for the presence of intoxicants or controlled substances as required by the Dane Co Jail.
- Defendant shall not be at any Hy-Vee store.
- Failure to abide by any portion of this Order or of these conditions of release may result in punishment for contempt of court, including the possibility of additional imprisonment for up to 6 months, additional charges, including but not limited to Felony Bail Jumping, a Class H Felony, which carries a maximum possible penalty of up to a $10,000 fine and up to 6 years imprisonment, or both.
 Trial Judge - Br 2
